alert.note: Alert for Aroostook; Piscataquis; Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 21 at 3:26PM EDT until July 21 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: The National Weather Service in Caribou Maine has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... North central Piscataquis County in north central Maine... Northwestern Aroostook County in northern Maine... Northern Somerset County in west central Maine... * Until 430 PM EDT. * At 326 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 12 miles southwest of Saint Pamphile to near Lac Frontiere to 9 miles south of Saint Juste, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Clayton Lake, Lac Frontiere, Daaquam, Saint Juste, Saint Pamphile and Nine-mile Bridge. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
